intro: Babiana reflexa, commonly known as the rain lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in late summer or early autumn, producing vibrant white or pink petals. Its bulbs are adapted to store water, allowing it to thrive in dry conditions. Babiana reflexa is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it adds ornamental value to the landscape.
